File Information Guidance.title: File Information Guidance field schema
File Information Guidance.description: File Information Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Description of the Files

Please describe how the data files are organized and how they fit together to make your dataset. Keep in mind that users of your data are not familiar with your data and might be new to the field and unfamiliar with common terminology, metrics, etc. Be more descriptive than necessary.

File Information Guidance.schema:name: File Information Guidance

File Naming Convention.schema:name: File Naming Convention
File Naming Convention.schema:description: Please describe any file naming convention that helps with understanding file content

Data And File Information Introduction.title: Data And File Information Introduction field schema
Data And File Information Introduction.description: Data And File Information Introduction field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Data and File Information

Many Dryad datasets include multiple files that hold a variety of data that fit together to make up the dataset. The goal of the data and file information is to help users understand those files, the data they contain, and how they fit together.

Data And File Information Introduction.schema:description: This field has HTML that explains the data and file information metadata
Data And File Information Introduction.schema:name: Data And File Information Introduction

Dataset Overview Guidance.title: Dataset Overview Guidance field schema
Dataset Overview Guidance.description: Dataset Overview Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Dataset Overview

Please provide an overview of the data files with:

  • File naming convention
  • Relationships between the files
  • Protocol Contributors
  • Additional data not included in the data package

Dataset Overview Guidance.schema:name: Dataset Overview Guidance

File Naming Convention Guidance.title: File Naming Convention Guidance field schema
File Naming Convention Guidance.description: File Naming Convention Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
File Naming Convention

Many datasets are made up of groups of similar files that might apply to different time periods, different locations, different variables, etc.. Many dataset creators define conventions for the names of those files, i.e. file naming conventions, so that they can easily distinguish them from one another and easily select files they want from a list.

These conventions can be described as a series of <tokens> that describe the order of the conventional content. For example, the convention for a name written as “last name, first name” would be <first><last>

File Naming Convention Guidance.schema:name: File Naming Convention Guidance

Relationships between the files Guidance.title: Relationships between the files Guidance field schema
Relationships between the files Guidance.description: Relationships between the files Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Relationships Between the Files

Datasets with multiple files can be organized in many ways and understanding that organization can be very helpful for users trying to understand the dataset. If your data are organized in a directory structure, describe it.

For example:

Organized by File Type
DatasetA.tar.gz
|- Data/
|  |- Processed/
|  |- Raw/
|- Results/
|  |- Figure1.tif
|  |- Figure2.tif
|  |- Models/
|- README.md
 
Organized by Analysis
DatasetB.tar.gz
|- Figure1/
|  |- Data/
|  |- Results
|  |  |- Figure1.tif
|- Figure2/
|  |- Data/
|  |- Results/
|  |  |- Figure2.tif
|- README.md

Relationships between the files Guidance.schema:name: Relationships between the files Guidance

Additional Data Not Included Guidance.title: Additional Data Not Included Guidance field schema
Additional Data Not Included Guidance.description: Additional Data Not Included Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Additional Data Not Included in Dataset

Additional data or metadata that are related to the dataset that might help a user understand or interpret the dataset are available, describe them here along with access instructions.

Additional Data Not Included Guidance.schema:name: Additional Data Not Included Guidance

propertyDescriptions.hasMetadata: If more complete metadata are available for this file, please provide an identifier or access instructions.
propertyDescriptions.numberOfVariables: How many variables are in the dataset?
propertyDescriptions.Variable Name and Definition: Name and definition of a variable

File Name Guidance.title: File Name Guidance field schema
File Name Guidance.description: File Name Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
File Name

The name of the files should provide information for unambiguous identification of the files in a list. A naming convention, described above, can be helpful.

File Name Guidance.schema:name: File Name Guidance

Description Guidance.title: Description Guidance field schema
Description Guidance.description: Description Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Description

The file description should describe the data in the file clearly as well as the role of the data in the file within the complete dataset. Why the data were created or included in the dataset can help users understand the bigger picture and the questions the data creator was thinking about when the data were created. Specifics about variables should be in the variable metadata.

Description Guidance.schema:name: Description Guidance

Format and Software Guidance.title: Format and Software Guidance field schema
Format and Software Guidance.description: Format and Software Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Format and Software

The format of the data is a primary consideration for interoperability so a clear description is important. If software is available for reading the data and reproducing results, mention that here. Software used to create the data, if available, could also be important.

Format and Software Guidance.schema:name: Format and Software Guidance

Number of Rows Guidance.title: Number of Rows Guidance field schema
Number of Rows Guidance.description: Number of Rows Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Number of Rows

For tabular datasets in tab- or comma-separated files or for some datasets in json, the number of rows can help users as a quick check on whether they are reading the data correctly.

Number of Rows Guidance.schema:name: Number of Rows Guidance

Number of Variables Guidance.title: Number of Variables Guidance field schema
Number of Variables Guidance.description: Number of Variables Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Number of Variables

The number of variables (columns in a tabular dataset) can help users as a quick check on whether they are reading the data correctly.

Number of Variables Guidance.schema:name: Number of Variables Guidance

Variable Metadata Guidance.title: Variable Metadata Guidance field schema
Variable Metadata Guidance.description: Variable Metadata Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Variable Metadata

name: A variable name that helps users understand its meaning and relationship to other variables. Abbreviations and acronyms should be avoided.
description: More details about the variable, how/why it was created and how it fits with the rest of the dataset.

Variable Metadata Guidance.schema:name: Variable Metadata Guidance

Missing Data Flag Metadata Guidance.title: Missing Data Flag Metadata Guidance field schema
Missing Data Flag Metadata Guidance.description: Missing Data Flag Metadata Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Missing Data Flag Metadata

name: A name of the flag that helps users understand its meaning and relationship to other missing values. Abbreviations and acronyms should be avoided.
value: The value used to indicate missing data.
description: The reason that the data are missing.

Missing Data Flag Metadata Guidance.schema:name: Missing Data Flag Metadata Guidance

Other Metadata for File Guidance.title: Other Metadata for File Guidance field schema
Other Metadata for File Guidance.description: Other Metadata for File Guidance field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.19

_ui._content:
Other Metadata for File

If the data in the file are described in metadata outside of Dryad, describe that metadata and how to access it here. For example, if DCAT collection metadata are available for the file, provide a link here.

Other Metadata for File Guidance.schema:name: Other Metadata for File Guidance
